alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Mayes; Muskogee; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 12:56AM CDT until June 18 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN ROGERS...SOUTHWESTERN MAYES...WAGONER...NORTHWESTERN CHEROKEE AND NORTHWESTERN MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 1255 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles east of Foyil to 4 miles southwest of Locust Grove to 3 miles northwest of Okay, moving northeast at 70 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS! HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Claremore... Wagoner... Coweta... Catoosa... Fort Gibson... Verdigris... Chouteau... Haskell... Inola... Okay... Porter... Taft... Tullahassee... Sequoyah State Park... Taiwah... Tiawah... Redbird... Jamesville... Mazie... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 239 and 260. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
